messages.content: I want to represent 3 columns of tabular data in a JSON file. These columns are called Name (3 random alphanumeric characters), Score (likely an integer), and Matches (an integer). Give an example file with these constraints.

Here is an example of how you could represent 3 columns of tabular data in a JSON file using the constraints you provided:```string{ Name: "John",
 Score: 6,
 Matches: 3}```The`Name`and`Score`and`Matches`fields are represented as strings using the '#' character. The`'#'`character is used to indicate that the data is not numeric, and it is not case-sensitive, so it can be used in many programming languages and frameworks.
The`'#'`character is used to indicate that the data is not numeric, and it is not case-sensitive, so it can be used in many programming languages and frameworks.
The`'#'`character is used to indicate that the data is not numeric, and it is not case-sensitive, so it can be used in many programming languages and frameworks.
In this example, the`Name`and`Score`fields are represented as strings, and the`Matches`field is represented as an integer.
In Javascript, how would I select the score of the entry with the fewest matches?
